In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple function in Julia that you can use to clean a column name as described:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    str = strip(str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    str = replace(str, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

This function takes a string `col` representing the column name and returns a new cleaned-up version of the string. It lowercases the string, strips any leading or trailing whitespace, and replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will return "my_column", which is the desired output for the example you provided.
